snippet: Tiger Woods’s success has helped push the black caddie to the brink of extinction.
abstract: Caddying, once perceived as a menial job that only blacks held, has become a vocation for the college-educated and failed professionals lured by the astronomical purses driven by Tiger Woods's immense popularity; Carl Jackson, who began caddying at age 11 to help his family, is one of the few remaining black caddies who will work Augusta National, where he will be toting the bag of golfer Ben Crenshaw in the Masters for the 36th time.
lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods’s success has helped push the black caddie to the brink of extinction.

headline.seo: Treasure of Golf’s Sad Past, Black Caddies Vanish in Era of Riches
headline.main: Treasure of Golf’s Sad Past, Black Caddies Vanish in Era of Riches
headline.print_headline: Treasure of Golf’s Sad Past, Black Caddies Vanish in Era of Riches
